translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Discourse with Pūraṇa Kassapa (Sundarika Bhāradvāja)
Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu viharati sundarikāya nadiyā tīre.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu viharati sundarikāya nadiyā tīre
translated: At one time the Fortunate One was dwelling amongst the Kosalans, on the bank of the river Sundarikā.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo sundarikāya nadiyā tīre aggiṁ juhati, aggihuttaṁ paricarati.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sundarikāya nadiyā tīre aggim juhati aggi huttam paricarati
translated: Then at that time the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja, on the bank of the river Sundarikā, was making a fire sacrifice, and was tending the sacred fire.

original: Atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo aggiṁ juhitvā aggihuttaṁ paricaritvā uṭṭhāyāsanā samantā catuddisā anuvilokesi:
analyzed: atha kho sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ aggim juhitvā aggihuttam paricaritvā uṭṭhāya āsanā samantā catuddisā anuvilokesi
translated: Then the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja, after making the fire sacrifice, and tending the sacred fire, having risen from his seat, looked around in the four directions, (thinking):

analyzed: kaḥ nu kho imam habyasesam bhuñjeyya ati
translated: “Who is there that could eat the remainder of this offering?”

original: Addasā kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ avidūre aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle sasīsaṁ pārutaṁ nisinnaṁ;
analyzed: addasā kho sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam avidūre aññatarasmim rukkha mūle sa sīsam pārutam nisinna
translated: The brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja saw the Fortunate One sitting not far away, his head and body covered,

original: disvāna vāmena hatthena habyasesaṁ gahetvā dakkhiṇena hatthena kamaṇḍaluṁ gahetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: disvāna vāmena hatthena habya sesam gahetvā dakkhiṇena hatthena kamaṇḍalum gahetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: and after seeing (him), taking the remainder of the offering in his left hand, and taking his water-pot in his right hand, he went to the Fortunate One.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa padasaddena sīsaṁ vivari.🔽Atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo: “muṇḍo ayaṁ bhavaṁ, muṇḍako ayaṁ bhavan”ti tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa pada saddena sīsam  atha kho sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ muṇḍaḥ ayam bhava muṇḍakaḥ ayam bhavanti tatas uva puna nivattitu kāmaḥ ahosi
translated: Then the Buddha opened his mouth to show his teeth to Sundarika Bharadvaja.🔽But when he saw that the Buddha was shaven-headed, he wanted to turn back.

analyzed: atha kho sundarikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

original: “muṇḍāpi hi idhekacce brāhmaṇā bhavanti, yannūnāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā jātiṁ puccheyyan”ti.
analyzed: muṇḍāḥ api hi idha ekacce brāhmaṇāḥ bhavanti yat nūna aham upasaṅkamitvā jātim puccheyyanti
translated: “There are some shaven-headed brahmins. Let me approach him and ask about his birth.”

original: Atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then went to the Buddha and said,
“What is your family?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājam brāhmaṇam gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi
translated: The Buddha replied with these verses:

analyzed: na brāhmaṇaḥ na umhi na rāja putto
translated: “I’m not a brahmin, nor am I a prince,
Nor am I a merchant or anyone else.

original: Gottaṁ pariññāya puthujjanānaṁ,🔽Akiñcano manta carāmi loke.
analyzed: gottam pariññāya puthujjanāna  akiñcanaḥ manta carāmi loke
translated: I’ve fully understood the families of ordinary people.
I’m free of possessions and wander the world.🔽I wear a robe and wander without possessions.
His hair is cut, he is fully extinguished;
Not smeared here by the young men,

analyzed: akallam mama brāhmaṇa pucchasi gotta pañha
translated: You ask me, brahmin, about my clan, which is not to be told.”
“The brahmins ask about brahmins,

original: Saha brāhmaṇo no bhavan”ti.🔽“Brāhmaṇo hi ce tvaṁ brūsi,
analyzed: saha brāhmaṇaḥ naḥ bhavanti  brāhmaṇaḥ hi ced tvam brūsi
translated: Are you a brahmin, sir?”🔽“If you say you are a brahmin,
Then you say a non-brahmin is;
I ask you about that Sāvitti,
With three feet and twenty-four syllables.”
“On what are seers and humans dependent,
Noble ones, brahmins, and gods;
By whom have many sacrifices been created in this world?”

analyzed: yad anta gū veda gū yañ a kāle
translated: “At the time of the sacrifice, the one who knows the end and the source,
I say, is the one who receives the offering.”
“Surely the offering is made to him,
(so says the brahmin)
We see such a one who knows the source;
Because of not seeing people like you,
Other people enjoy the full reward.”
“Therefore, brahmin, for the sake of your own benefit,
Come and ask;
Peaceful, smoke-free, free from danger and anxiety,
Thus you will find the wise one.”
“I delight in sacrifice, Master Gotama,

analyzed: yaññam yiṭṭhu kāmaḥ na aham pajānāmi
translated: I wish to perform a great sacrifice, but I do not know🔽how to perform a successful sacrifice.
Please advise me, Master Gotama,

original: Yattha hutaṁ ijjhate brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: yattha hutam ijjhate brūhi me ta
translated: on how to perform a successful sacrifice. Please tell me.”🔽“Well then, brahmin, listen and pay careful attention as I tell you

original: “Tena hi tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, odahassu sotaṁ; dhammaṁ te desessāmi—
analyzed: tena hi tva brāhmaṇaḥ odahassu sa uta dhammam te desessāmi
translated: about the sacrifice at which the oblation is offered into the fire of wisdom,

analyzed: mā jātim pucchī caraṇam ca puccha
translated: not into the fire of wood.
The fire of wisdom is born from the wood of good actions.
Even if a sage is born in a low family,🔽if he is wise and restrained by a sense of shame,🔽he is to be called a brahmin,

original: Ājāniyo hoti hirīnisedho.🔽Saccena danto damasā upeto,
analyzed: ājāniyaḥ hoti hirīnisedhaḥ  saccena dantaḥ damasāḥ
translated: one who should receive the sacrificial oblation.🔽One who is restrained by the truth, endowed with self-control,
who has gone beyond doubt, and has lived the spiritual life,🔽he is the one who should receive the sacrificial oblation
if a brahmin wishes to perform a sacrifice in search of merit.

original: Ye kāme hitvā agahā caranti,🔽Susaññatattā tasaraṁva ujjuṁ;
analyzed: ye kāme hitvā agahā caranti  su sañña tat tā tasaravaḥ ujju
translated: Those who, having given up sense pleasures,🔽are straight like a well-polished shell,
they are the ones who should receive the sacrificial oblation
if a brahmin wishes to perform a sacrifice in search of merit.

analyzed: ye vīta rāgā su samāhita indriyā
translated: Those who are free from passion, with well-concentrated faculties,
like the moon released from Rahu’s grasp,
they are the ones who should receive the sacrificial oblation
if a brahmin wishes to perform a sacrifice in search of merit.
They wander in the world without clinging,
Always mindful, having abandoned what is mine,
In time he should offer a sacrifice to them,
The brahmin who desires merit should sacrifice.
He who has abandoned sense pleasures, who has overcome conduct,
Who knows the end of birth and death,

analyzed: parinibbutaḥ udaka rahadaḥ uva sīto  tathāgataḥ arahati pūraḍā āsa
translated: Extinguished like a cool pond,🔽The Realised One deserves a full ladle.
The Realised One is the same with the same and different with the different,
The Realised One is of infinite wisdom;
Unstained here or beyond,
The Realised One deserves a full ladle.

original: Yamhi na māyā vasati na māno,🔽Yo vītalobho amamo nirāso;
analyzed: yamhi na māyā vasati na mānaḥ  yaḥ vīta lobhaḥ amamaḥ
translated: In whom deceit and conceit do not dwell,🔽Who is free from greed, without possessions, without hope;
His anger cast aside, he is well extinguished,
The brahmin who has removed the stain of sorrow,
The Realised One deserves a full ladle.
He who has removed the abode of the mind,
For whom there are no possessions at all;
Not clinging here or beyond,
The Realised One deserves a full ladle.
He who, concentrated, has crossed over the flood,
And has known the Dhamma with the highest view;
With his pollutants destroyed, bearing his last body,

original: Tathāgato arahati pūraḷāsaṁ.🔽Bhavāsavā yassa vacī kharā ca,
analyzed: tathāgataḥ arahati pūraḍā āsa  bhava asavāḥ yassa vacī kharā ca
translated: The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.🔽For one who has no desire for existence, and whose speech is not harsh,
Who has blown out the defilements, and they have gone, and are not,
The knower of the spiritual life, who is released in every way,
The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.

analyzed: saṅga atigaḥ yassa na santi saṅgā
translated: The one who has gone beyond the attachments, who has no attachments,

analyzed: yaḥ māna sattesu a māna sattaḥ
translated: Who is not attached to living beings,
Having fully understood suffering, and the basis of the field,

analyzed: tathāgataḥ arahati pūraḍā āsa  āsam a nissāya viveka dassī
translated: The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.🔽The one who has seen the ending of attachments, who is free from attachments,
Who has gone beyond the views of others,
For whom there is no object of perception,
The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.

analyzed: para uparā yassa samet ca dhammā
translated: The one who has seen the Dhamma above and below,
Who has blown out the defilements, and they have gone, and are not,
The peaceful one, released in the destruction of attachments,
The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.
The one who has seen the ending of birth, the end of attachments,
Who has completely destroyed the path of passion,
The pure one, the one without a womb, the stainless one, the one without a belly,
The Realised One is worthy of the highest offering.
The one who does not see self in self,
The one who is concentrated, upright, and steady,
He is indeed free from agitation, free from enmity, free from doubt,
The Realised One deserves the full bowl.
He who has no darkness at all,

original: Sabbesu dhammesu ca ñāṇadassī;🔽Sarīrañca antimaṁ dhāreti,
analyzed: sabbesu dhammesu ca ñāṇa dassī  sarīram ca antimam dhārā iti
translated: And who sees with knowledge and insight all things,🔽Who bears his last body,
And has attained the supreme, peaceful, and unsurpassed Awakening,
To this extent there is purity for the yakkha,
The Realised One deserves the full bowl.”

analyzed: hutam ca mayham hutam atthu sat ca
translated: “What I have offered has been offered well, truly,
That I have obtained one with such knowledge and skills;

original: Brahmā hi sakkhi paṭigaṇhātu me bhagavā,
analyzed: brahmā hi sakkhi paṭigaṇhātu me bhagavā
translated: Brahmā, the Fortunate One, my Lord, should accept it,
May the Fortunate One enjoy my full bowl.”
“What is sung in a verse is not to be eaten by me,
This is not the rule for one who sees, Brahmin;
The Buddhas reject what is sung in a verse,
This is the rule, Brahmin, when there is the Dhamma.
But with another (offering) you should serve the Great Sage, the Worthy One,
Who has destroyed the pollutants, and is free from remorse,
With food and drink,
For he is a field of merit for one who desires merit.”
“It is good for me, Fortunate One, that I know this,
That one like me should enjoy an offering;
Whatever I was seeking at the time of the sacrifice,
I have attained by receiving your teaching.”

analyzed: sā ārambhā vigatā  cittam yassa anāvila
translated: “He who is free from agitation,🔽whose mind is unclouded,

original: Vippamutto ca kāmehi,🔽Thinaṁ yassa panūditaṁ.🔽Sīmantānaṁ vinetāraṁ,🔽Jātimaraṇakovidaṁ;
analyzed: vippamuttaḥ ca kāmehi  thinam yassa  sīmantānam vinetāra  jāti maraṇa kovida
translated: who is liberated from sensual pleasures,🔽and has dispelled sloth,🔽the one who tames the unkempt,🔽who is skilled in birth and death,
the sage who is endowed with austerity,
such a one has come to the sacrifice.
Having removed your frown,
pay homage with palms joined;
worship him with food and drink,
thus offerings will be successful.”
“The Blessed One deserves the pūraṇa fruit,
the unsurpassed field of merit;
a recipient for the whole world,
what is given to the Blessed One is of great fruit.”

original: Atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the brahmin Sundarikabhāradvāja said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,🔽in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: as if lighting a lamp in the darkness so that those with eyes could see.

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.🔽Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito  esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: In many ways the Lord has made the Dhamma clear.🔽I go to the Lord Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.🔽Alattha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo …pe…
analyzed: labheyya aham bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti  alattha kho sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pe
translated: May the Lord Gotama accept me from this day forth as a lay-follower as long as life shall last!
And Sundarika Bharadvaja received the going forth in the Lord’s presence, and he received ordination.
and soon attained to right and perfect enlightenment.🔽The Fourth Portion for Repeating.
